Name: Offering basin
Description: Rectangular offering basins with a draining groove on one long side were used in Egypt from the Old Kingdom onwards. They were adopted by the Kushites along with the religious concepts. Offering basins from Sayala may be regarded as an indication that the carousals in the wine houses had a cultic character. Sandstone offering basins with steps on the inside are a characteristic motif of the Meroitic culture.
